oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Acoustic-mode-driven electron-phonon coupling in transition-metal diborides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, PP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: linear-response theory
mgb2
superconductivity

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We show that the electron-phonon coupling lambda(qnu) in the transition-metal diborides NbB2 and TaB2 is dominated by the longitudinal acoustical (LA) mode, in contrast to the optical E-2g-mode-dominated coupling in MgB2. Our ab initio results, described in terms of phonon dispersion, linewidth, and lambda(qnu) along Gamma-A, also show that (i) NbB2 and TaB2 have a relatively weak electron-phonon coupling, (ii) the E-2g linewidth is an order of magnitude larger in MgB2 than in NbB2 or TaB2, (iii) the E-2g frequency in NbB2 and TaB2 is considerably higher than in MgB2, and (iv) the LA frequency at A for TaB2 is almost half of that of MgB2 or NbB2.
